description: Quickly add to Memory by starting your message with '#'
notes: First public-facing memory feature. Users could prefix messages with # to write to CLAUDE.md memory files.

description: Fixed issue where pasting could trigger memory or bash mode unexpectedly
notes: Pasting text accidentally triggered memory mode, showing the # prefix was parsed from input content.

description: Shared project permission rules can be saved in .claude/settings.json
notes: Laid groundwork for .claude/ directory as a project-level configuration and memory store.

description: CLAUDE.md files can now import other files. Add @path/to/file.md to ./CLAUDE.md to load additional files on launch
notes: CLAUDE.md becomes composable. Memory files can reference other files, creating a graph of project knowledge.

description: Migrated allowedTools and ignorePatterns from .claude.json -> settings.json. Deprecated claude config commands in favor of editing settings.json
notes: Memory and config consolidation from .claude.json to settings.json structure.

description: Performance optimizations for memory usage
notes: General memory performance improvements for the memory subsystem.

description: Fixed a memory leak causing a MaxListenersExceededWarning message to appear
notes: Memory leak in event listener system affecting long-running sessions.

description: You can now create custom subagents for specialized tasks! Run /agents to get started
notes: Foundation for agent memory - custom agents that can be configured with specific behaviors and tools.

description: Added @-mention support with typeahead for custom agents. @<your-custom-agent> to invoke it
notes: Agents become directly invocable via @-mentions, tightening the agent interaction model.

description: Agents: Added model customization support - you can now specify which model an agent should use
notes: Agents gain model parameter, allowing different agents to use different models.

description: Enhanced /doctor command with CLAUDE.md and MCP tool context for self-serve debugging
notes: /doctor now understands CLAUDE.md memory files and can help debug context issues.

description: @-mention: Add ~/.claude/* files to suggestions for easier agent, output style, and slash command editing
notes: Users can now @-mention files in the ~/.claude directory, making memory file editing more accessible.

description: /memory command now allows direct editing of all imported memory files
notes: The /memory command evolves from simple viewing to full editing capability across all imported memory files.

description: Fixed keyboard navigation becoming unresponsive when holding down arrow keys in memory location selector
interactions: User -> memory location selector -> keyboard input
notes: The memory location selector is a UI for choosing where to store memories (user, project, local).

description: Added --agent CLI flag to override the agent setting for the current session. Added agent setting to configure main thread with a specific agent's system prompt, tool restrictions, and model
notes: Agents become a first-class configuration concept. The main thread can be configured as a specific agent.

description: Added support for .claude/rules/. See https://code.claude.com/docs/en/memory for details.
notes: Introduction of .claude/rules/ directory as a dedicated memory structure. The /memory docs URL confirms this is the memory system's evolution.

description: Removed # shortcut for quick memory entry (tell Claude to edit your CLAUDE.md instead)
notes: The original # memory shortcut from 0.2.54 is removed. Memory entry now goes through Claude editing CLAUDE.md directly.

description: Improved memory usage by 3x for large conversations
notes: 3x memory usage improvement for large conversations, showing scale of memory optimization work.

description: Fixed binary files (images, PDFs, etc.) being accidentally included in memory when using @include directives in CLAUDE.md files
notes: The @include system in CLAUDE.md was accidentally pulling binary files into memory context.

description: Fixed a memory leak where tree-sitter parse trees were not being freed, causing WASM memory to grow unbounded over long sessions
notes: Memory leak in the code parsing subsystem affecting long-running sessions.

description: Improved the external CLAUDE.md imports approval dialog to show which files are being imported and from where
notes: Better transparency into what memory files are being imported and their sources.

description: Added automatic discovery of skills from nested .claude/skills directories when working with files in subdirectories
notes: Skills in nested .claude/skills/ directories are now auto-discovered, expanding the agent memory ecosystem.

description: Added support for loading CLAUDE.md files from additional directories specified via --add-dir flag
notes: CLAUDE.md memory files can now be loaded from additional directories beyond the project root.

description: Improved memory usage for --resume (68% reduction for users with many sessions) by replacing the session index with lightweight stat-based loading and progressive enrichment
notes: 68% memory reduction for session resume, significant optimization for memory management.

description: Claude now automatically records and recalls memories as it works
notes: LANDMARK: Claude gains automatic memory. No longer requires manual # prefix or explicit /memory commands. Claude proactively records and recalls memories during work sessions.

description: Added memory frontmatter field support for agents, enabling persistent memory with user, project, or local scope
interactions: Agent frontmatter memory field -> persistent memory with scope
notes: LANDMARK: Agents gain persistent memory via frontmatter field. Three scopes: user (global across projects), project (per-project), local (machine-local). This is the agent memory feature fully realized.

description: Added support for restricting which sub-agents can be spawned via Task(agent_type) syntax in agent tools frontmatter
interactions: Agent tools field -> sub-agent spawning restrictions
notes: Agents can now control which sub-agents they spawn, creating a hierarchy of agent interactions.

description: Added TeammateIdle and TaskCompleted hook events for multi-agent workflows
notes: Hook events for multi-agent collaboration, showing agents interacting as teams.
